descendants.content:
Just why would you ‘risk’ any #climate tipping point, it’s like playing Russian Roulette with our future generations!

Our net carbon sinks this year, only absorbed what was emitted. We are toying with the tipping point of our worlds forests, becoming net carbon emitters! Oh fuck.

無 pic is the word, mu, in kanji as a white emoji with an orange background. Google made it. (https://github.com/googlei18n/noto-emoji/blob/f2a4f72/svg/emoji_u1f21a.svg, Apache License 2.0 https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=34839462)

descendants.content:
@nspugh Yes, I listened to the Good Fire podcast, and the aboriginals probably know the most. Native people on the west coast of "N. America" have been trying to relearn what was a crime punishable by death. Through this fediverse and then, a little on my own, I found out some Japanese people never quit a similar practice called slash & burn.

Before civilization, there wasn't a need to control forest fires. Of course, now there's the necessity from so much prevention.

descendants.content:
@mu of course, it is all about mimicking natural processes, like huge herds of wilder beasts that would ‘conservation graze’ under growth out, that reduced the impact a severity of the burn.

Mixed grazing animals - conservation grazing, is also important to employ in many areas that wish to employ agroecological, regenerative farming practices.

media_attachments.description:
Meme showing two men sitting at two tables side by side. 

One table is labeled Comforting Lies, with the man saying "1.5C is still avoidable! Green capitalism will save us! Buy my Hopium book!"

The other table is labeled Unpleasant Truths, with the man saying nothing. 

There is a long line of ppl in front of the Comforting Lies table. 

There is no one in front of the Unpleasant Truths table.
